snippet: A judge ruled that approval from the city’s voters was not necessary in order to use bond proceeds to build a new facility that was expected to cost nearly $1 billion.
abstract: NFL Roundup; Circuit Judge Thomas Frawley rules that voter approval is not required before bond proceeds can be used to construct new football stadium in St Louis; other football news noted.
lead_paragraph: A judge ruled that approval from the city’s voters was not necessary in order to use bond proceeds to build a new facility that was expected to cost nearly $1 billion.

headline.print_headline: Ruling Favorable to New St. Louis Stadium
headline.main: Ruling Gives a Lift to New St. Louis Stadium
